required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ABRE Clinical Study of the Abre Venous Self-expanding Stent System
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Non-randomized Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of the Abre Venous Self-expanding Stent System in Patients With Symptomatic Iliofemoral Venous Outflow Obstruction

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the Abre venous self-expanding stent system for treatment of symptomatic iliofemoral venous outflow obstruction in patients with venous occlusive disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Primary Patency
primary_outcome.description: Freedom from occlusion of the stented segment; freedom from restenosis >=50%; and Freedom from clinically-driven target lesion revascularization

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Composite Major Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: The components of the Major Adverse Events include: All-cause death occurring post-procedure, clinically-significant pulmonary embolism, major bleeding complication, stent thrombosis, and stent migration

secondary_outcome.measure: Device Success
secondary_outcome.description: Successful delivery and deployment of the stent and removal of the delivery system during the index procedure. Stent based outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lesion Success Obtained at Index Procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Venographic evidence of <50% residual stenosis of the stented segment of the target lesion after post-dilation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Index Procedure Success
secondary_outcome.description: Lesion success without procedure-related MAEs prior to hospital discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Primary Patency at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from occlusion of the stented segment; freedom from restenosis >=50%; and Freedom from clinically-driven target lesion revascularization

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Primary Patency at 36 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from occlusion of the stented segment; freedom from restenosis >=50%; and Freedom from clinically-driven target lesion revascularization

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Primary Assisted Patency at 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Primary assisted patency is defined as uninterrupted patency of the stented segment of the target lesion with a secondary intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Primary Assisted Patency at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Primary assisted patency is defined as uninterrupted patency of the stented segment of the target lesion with a secondary intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Primary Assisted Patency at 36 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Primary assisted patency is defined as uninterrupted patency of the stented segment of the target lesion with a secondary intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Secondary Patency at 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary patency is defined as patency of the stented segment of the target lesion after subsequent intervention for an occlusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Secondary Patency at 36 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary patency is defined as patency of the stented segment of the target lesion after subsequent intervention for an occlusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects With Secondary Patency at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary patency is defined as patency of the stented segment of the target lesion after subsequent intervention for an occlusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Target Lesion Revascularization Through 30 Days, 6-, 12 Months
Target Lesion Revascularization Through 24 Months
Target Lesion Revascularization Through 36 Months
Major Adverse Events Through 30 Days, 6-, 12 Months
Major Adverse Events Through 24 Months
Major Adverse Events Through 36 Months
Delayed Stent Migration at 12 Months
Delayed Stent Migration at 24 Months
Delayed Stent Migration at 36 Months
Stent Fracture at 30 Days, 12 Months
Stent Fracture at 24 Months
Stent Fracture at 36 Months
Change in Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study - Quality of Life/Symptoms QOL/Sym Score at 6-, 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study - Quality of Life/Symptoms (VEINES QOL/Sym). Higher scores correlate to better quality of life on a scale of 1-100. Change in VEINES QOL/Sym scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (6 or 12 months). A positive change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study - Quality of Life/Symptoms QOL/Sym Score at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study - Quality of Life/Symptoms (VEINES QOL/Sym). Higher scores correlate to better quality of life on a scale of 1-100. Change in VEINES QOL/Sym scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (24 months). A positive change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study - Quality of Life/Symptoms QOL/Sym Score at 36 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Venous Insufficiency Epidemiological and Economic Study - Quality of Life/Symptoms (VEINES QOL/Sym). Higher scores correlate to better quality of life on a scale of 1-100. Change in VEINES QOL/Sym scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (36 months). A positive change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Villalta Score at 6-, 12 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Villalta scores categorize the severity of post-thrombotic syndrome (PTS). Higher score indicates increasing severity of PTS. A score of greater or equal to 5 indicates PTS. PTS severity: total score of 5 to 9, mild PTS; score of 10 to 14, moderate PTS; and score of greater or equal to 15 or venous ulcer present, severe PTS. Change in Villalta scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (6 or 12 months). A negative change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Villalta Score at 24 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Villalta scores categorize the severity of post-thrombotic syndrome (PTS). Higher score indicates increasing severity of PTS. A score of greater or equal to 5 indicates PTS. PTS severity: total score of 5 to 9, mild PTS; score of 10 to 14, moderate PTS; and score of greater or equal to 15 or venous ulcer present, severe PTS. Change in Villalta scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (24 months). A negative change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Villalta Score at 36 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Villalta scores categorize the severity of post-thrombotic syndrome (PTS). Higher score indicates increasing severity of PTS. A score of greater or equal to 5 indicates PTS. PTS severity: total score of 5 to 9, mild PTS; score of 10 to 14, moderate PTS; and score of greater or equal to 15 or venous ulcer present, severe PTS. Change in Villalta scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (36 months). A negative change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EuroQol-5 Dimension (EQ-5D) Score at 6-, 12 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Higher score indicates a better quality of life. The questionnaire contains five dimensions where scores rank from 1 (best) to 5 (worst) plus a visual analog scale (VAS) (0 = worst health; 100 = best health). A positive change is associated with improved outcome. Change in EQ-5D scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (6 or 12 months) for both the index and VAS scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EuroQol-5 Dimension (EQ-5D) Score at 24 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Higher score indicates a better quality of life. The questionnaire contains five dimensions where scores rank from 1 (best) to 5 (worst) plus a visual analog scale (VAS) (0 = worst health; 100 = best health). A positive change is associated with improved outcome. Change in EQ-5D scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (24 months) for both the index and VAS scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EuroQol-5 Dimension (EQ-5D) Score at 36 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Higher score indicates a better quality of life. The questionnaire contains five dimensions where scores rank from 1 (best) to 5 (worst) plus a visual analog scale (VAS) (0 = worst health; 100 = best health). A positive change is associated with improved outcome. Change in EQ-5D scores were calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (36 months) for both the index and VAS scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Venous Clinical Severity Score (VCSS) at 6-, and 12 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: VCSS scores range from 0=no disease to 30=severe disease. Change in VCSS score was calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (6 or 12 months). A negative change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Venous Clinical Severity Score (VCSS) at 24 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: VCSS scores range from 0=no disease to 30=severe disease. Change in VCSS score was calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (24 months). A negative change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Venous Clinical Severity Score (VCSS) at 36 Months Compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: VCSS scores range from 0=no disease to 30=severe disease. Change in VCSS score was calculated as the Baseline score minus the Follow-up score (36 months). A negative change is associated with improved outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Major Bleeding Complication at 30 Days, 6-, 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: A blood loss leading to transfusion of whole blood or red cells provided hemoglobin drop of 3 g/dL (1.86 mmol/L) or more is related to bleeding occurring during the index procedure through 12 months post-index procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Major Bleeding Complication at 24 Months
secondary_outcome.description: A blood loss leading to transfusion of whole blood or red cells provided hemoglobin drop of 3 g/dL (1.86 mmol/L) or more is related to bleeding occurring during the index procedure through 24 months post-index procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Major Bleeding Complication at 36 Months
secondary_outcome.description: A blood loss leading to transfusion of whole blood or red cells provided hemoglobin drop of 3 g/dL (1.86 mmol/L) or more is related to bleeding occurring during the index procedure through 36 months post-index procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject Re-hospitalization Through 12 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects that were re-hospitalized due to their target lesion within 180 days from the Index Procedure and number of subjects that were re-hospitalized due to their target lesion from 181 to 360 days from the Index Procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject Re-hospitalization Through 24 Months
Subject Re-hospitalization Through 36 Months

facility.name: Assistance Publique - Hôpitaux de Marseille - Hôpital Nord
Galway University Hospitals - University Hospital Galway
University College London Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust - University College London Hospitals
Guy's & St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust - St Thomas' Hospital

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were screened for enrollment based on the study Inclusion/Exclusion criteria between December 2017 and November 2018. Included subjects went on to have one or more Abre stents implanted. The first subject was included on December 19, 2017 and the last subject was included on November 29, 2018.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 260 enrolled subjects, 200 met inclusion criteria and were implanted with the Abre stent(s).

group.title: ABRE
group.description: Subjects implanted with one or more Abre stents.

group.title: ABRE
group.description: Subjects included and implanted with one or more Abre stents

Body Mass Index (BMI)

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Primary Patency
outcome.description: Freedom from occlusion of the stented segment; freedom from restenosis >=50%; and Freedom from clinically-driven target lesion revascularization
outcome.population: Subjects evaluable for the primary effectiveness endpoint.

group.title: ABRE
group.description: Subjects implanted with one or more Abre stents.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Primary Patency
measure.description: Freedom from occlusion of the stented segment; freedom from restenosis >=50%; and Freedom from clinically-driven target lesion revascularization
measure.population: Subjects evaluable for the primary effectiveness endpoint.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary effectiveness endpoint, primary patency at 12 months, was tested against a PG of 75%. The null and alternative hypotheses tested appear below: H0: π ≤ PG vs. HA: π > PG where π is the primary patency rate at 12 months in the study population and PG is the performance goal of 75%. The primary effectiveness objective will be met if the lower limit of the 97.5% one-sided confidence interval is above 75%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Single arm study with a hypothesis test comparing to performance goal

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Composite Major Adverse Events
outcome.description: The components of the Major Adverse Events include: All-cause death occurring post-procedure, clinically-significant pulmonary embolism, major bleeding complication, stent thrombosis, and stent migration

group.title: ABRE
group.description: Subjects implanted with one or more Abre stents.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Composite Major Adverse Events
measure.description: The components of the Major Adverse Events include: All-cause death occurring post-procedure, clinically-significant pulmonary embolism, major bleeding complication, stent thrombosis, and stent migration

analysis.groups_desc: The primary safety endpoint, major adverse events at 30 days post-procedure, was tested against a performance goal of 12.5%. The null and alternative hypotheses tested appear below: H0: P ≥ PG vs. HA: P < PG where P is the primary safety endpoint at 30 days in the study population and PG is the performance goal. The primary safety objective will be met if the upper limit of the 97.5% one-sided confidence interval is below 12.5%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Single-arm study with a hypothesis test comparing to performance goal

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
